<a href="https://michiganross.umich.edu/graduate/online-mba/cpn/get-where-you-want-to-be?utm_id=GM_MR_00236&utm_campaign=OMBA&utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=primarycontent&utm_content=mbslippers&a=All&i=morningbrew&j=USNAT" style="border-bottom:none!important;" target="_blank" class=""><img alt="Michigan Ross" style="width:100%;max-width: 200px; display: inline; vertical-align: middle;" width="200" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc5MjkxOTU4LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ=="></a>
</th>

<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good Tuesday morning. </strong>Do you hear that? The faint sound of drumming on trash cans? It can only mean one thing: MLB spring training starts exactly one month from today.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But you don't have to wait another second for the latest episode of Morning Brew's <em>Business Casual </em>podcast. This week, we chat with entrepreneur <span>Moiz Ali, who in 2017 sold his natural personal care startup to P&G for $100 million. Listen: <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/Moiz_Apple" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Apple</a> / <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/Moiz_Spotify" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Spotify</a> / <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/Moiz_All" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">everywhere else</a> </span></p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
2020
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/20/democratic-candidates-released-plans-tackle-racial-economic-inequality?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Courting of Black Americans
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Pete Buttigieg and Rev. Al Sharpton " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc5NTU2NzA0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>TIMOTHY A. CLARY/AFP via Getty Image</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Presidential campaigns aren’t all four-hour selfie lines. Democrats vying for the nomination are putting on their wonk hats and unveiling plans to tackle racial economic inequality.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The numbers:</strong> McKinsey <a href="https://www.mckinsey.com/industries/public-sector/our-insights/the-economic-impact-of-closing-the-racial-wealth-gap?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">estimates</a> that closing the racial wealth gap could lift U.S. GDP 4%–6% by 2028. Reducing barriers to banking alone could put $40,000 back into the pockets of black individuals. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Plan overload</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Sunday, former NYC mayor <strong style="color:#000">Mike Bloomberg</strong> <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/mike-bloomberg-at-site-of-racial-massacre-vows-aid-for-african-americans/2020/01/19/90780cd0-3aa3-11ea-baca-eb7ace0a3455_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">outlined</a> plans to triple the wealth of the average black family and almost double the ranks of black-owned businesses.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, former MA Gov. <strong style="color:#000">Deval Patrick</strong> released his “<a href="https://medium.com/@DevalPatrick/an-equity-agenda-for-black-americans-73a926e2ee2?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Equity Agenda for Black Americans</a>,” which includes supporting a plan for the federal government to pay reparations to the living descendants of African American slaves. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Bloomberg and Patrick join other Democratic candidates who’ve already laid out blueprints pledging better housing, healthcare, and education for black Americans. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Sen. Elizabeth Warren </strong></span><span>wants to give minority entrepreneurs $7 billion in federal grants to help them start new companies. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Pete Buttigieg’s</strong></span><span> “Douglass Plan” seeks to </span><span><a href="https://www.vox.com/policy-and-politics/2019/7/11/20690710/pete-buttigieg-douglass-plan-systemic-racism-black-voters?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">triple</a></span><span> the number of entrepreneurs from underrepresented backgrounds and forgive or defer loans to black college students who create businesses after graduation. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Plans =/= votes </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Black Americans are the Democratic Party’s most consistent voting segment. While 2016 turnout dropped 7 percentage points from 2012, many Democratic operatives are confident black voters will <a href="https://apnews.com/bfc3c2a4a3384fd98676de85c4c34b98?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">return</a> in higher numbers this year and play a decisive role in swing states like Michigan. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But...someone has to win.</strong> Former VP Joe Biden has polled with anywhere from <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/as-primary-voting-nears-joe-biden-remains-strong-with-black-democrats-11579538921?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">a third</a> to <a href="https://www.vox.com/2020/1/13/21063906/joe-biden-national-poll-black-voters-primary?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">almost half</a> of black Democratic voters in his corner. Bernie Sanders is a steady No. 2 with 24%, according to a Quinnipiac poll, and Warren is in third with <10%. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Don’t count the black vote as a </span><span><a href="https://fivethirtyeight.com/features/why-do-black-democrats-usually-prefer-establishment-candidates/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">monolith</a></span><span>, either. Polls show young black voters prefer Sanders.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Biden’s strength with black voters will be tested next month in South Carolina, the first early primary state with a large black electorate.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/20/evan-spiegel-says-tiktok-overtake-instagram?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Spiegel’s Got a Crush on TikTok
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="An illustration of Snap's ghost with a backwards cap on its head" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTYzOTIwOTEzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In Munich on Sunday, Snap CEO Evan Spiegel said “<a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/01/20/tiktok-pulled-into-the-middle-of-a-fight-between-snap-and-facebook.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">it’s possible</a>” that TikTok, the Chinese video sharing app, could overtake Instagram. Yes—that Instagram, the platform with more than 1 billion monthly active users and which Bloomberg <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-06-25/value-of-facebook-s-instagram-estimated-to-top-100-billion?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">estimated</a> to be worth over $100 billion in 2018.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Why? </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>TikTok’s “talent-based content is often more interesting than status-based content.” Meaning clever lip syncing > pics of glamping in Patagonia. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“I love TikTok,” Spiegel said. “I’m a big fan.”</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>With Zuck leading the charge, Facebook-owned Instagram has earned a reputation for copying some of Snapchat’s most beloved features, such as Stories. As Snap tries to escape Insta’s shadow, it’s invested in <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2019/11/20/snap-commits-750000-ar-influencers-2020?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">augmented reality tech</a> to differentiate itself from its peers. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">TikTok, on the other hand, came out of nowhere to become the <a href="https://go.sensortower.com/rs/351-RWH-315/images/Sensor-Tower-Q4-2019-Data-Digest.pdf?src=landing-page&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">second-most downloaded app</a> in the world in 2019, according to Sensor Tower. Only WhatsApp (another FB property) was more popular.  </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Snap%27s+CEO+thinks+users+will+gravitate+to+%22talent-based+content%22+instead+of+%22status-based%22+&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/20/evan-spiegel-says-tiktok-overtake-instagram&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86576e04837.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e8657887c532.jpg">
</a>
</td>

</td>

</th>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PUBLIC HEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/20/dangerous-virus-comes-worst-possible-time-china?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Dangerous Virus Comes at Worst Possible Time for China
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Coronavirus might sound like Day 2 of your Cabo trip, but it's causing concern across China ahead of one of the country's busiest travel seasons. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Monday, Chinese authorities <a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2020/01/20/797926447/coronavirus-in-china-over-200-cases-human-to-human-transmission?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported</a> the virus, which causes pneumonia-like symptoms, had infected 200+ people with three confirmed deaths. U.K. experts <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/health-51048366?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> the number of cases may be closer to 1,700.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The situation is triggering memories of China’s 2002 SARS outbreak (another coronavirus strain), which infected 8,000+ people and killed 774.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Health officials say animals passed the virus to humans at a market in Wuhan, China. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>There are now confirmed cases in major metro areas (Beijing, Shenzhen) and Thailand, South Korea, and Japan. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What scares health officials even more: </strong>They believe the virus may be spreading from human to human. The Chinese New Year is this Saturday, and an <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-19/wuhan-pneumonia-outbreak-widens-with-china-increasing-screening?srnd=premium%5C&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">estimated</a> 3 billion trips are expected across the country. Shares in Chinese travel and hospitality companies sank yesterday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the <span>World Health Organization</span> will meet tomorrow to decide if this needs to be elevated to a global public health emergency.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It used to be that achieving prestige in the business world meant you had to take off your fluffy slippers.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">No longer. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The University of Michigan’s Ross School of Business launched <a href="https://michiganross.umich.edu/graduate/online-mba/cpn/get-where-you-want-to-be?utm_id=GM_MR_00236&utm_campaign=OMBA&utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=primarycontent&utm_content=mbslippers&a=All&i=morningbrew&j=USNAT" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">an Online MBA program</a>. You can now receive one of the most prestigious business educations on your own schedule from the comfort of your home.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The <a href="https://michiganross.umich.edu/graduate/online-mba/cpn/get-where-you-want-to-be?utm_id=GM_MR_00236&utm_campaign=OMBA&utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=primarycontent&utm_content=mbslippers&a=All&i=morningbrew&j=USNAT" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Ross Online MBA</a> requires a GMAT or GRE to ensure you’ll be surrounded by high caliber peers who are ready to take on the challenges of B-school. You’ll also get access to Ross career support, on-campus recruiting, and action-based learning experiences.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The innovative online format combines self-guided modules with interactive live classes. Plus, students attend a set of rigorous on-campus residencies. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Score a Top 10 business education</strong> and rock those slippers while you’re at it, future business titans. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Launch your new career trajectory with <a href="https://michiganross.umich.edu/graduate/online-mba/cpn/get-where-you-want-to-be?utm_id=GM_MR_00236&utm_campaign=OMBA&utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=primarycontent&utm_content=mbslippers&a=All&i=morningbrew&j=USNAT" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Michigan Ross’s Online MBA today</a>.</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/20/spacex-takes-another-step-toward-launching-crewed-missions-space?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Mission Accomplished
</font></a>
</h1>

<img class="story-header-image" alt="SpaceX launch " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/dt0Eb3F3FMjjPN1LLs/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy/NASA</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That is not a joke. On Sunday, SpaceX <a href="https://www.space.com/spacex-crew-dragon-launch-abort-test-success.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">successfully blew up</a> one of its Falcon 9 rockets in a test of its abort system. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The company needed to prove astronauts can be safely ejected from the spacecraft in the event of a bad launch, and, well, it was a “picture perfect mission,” <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-space-exploration-spacex/spacex-says-picture-perfect-test-paves-way-for-human-mission-idUSKBN1ZI054?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">according to CEO Elon Musk</a>. “It went as well as one can possibly expect.” </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>No one was in the capsule this time around. But if all goes according to plan, SpaceX will send NASA astronauts to space as early as the second quarter of this year. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Humans haven’t traveled to the International Space Station from U.S. soil since NASA pulled the plug on the space shuttle program in 2011. </span></li>
</ul>

<img alt="Sundance Film Festival " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MTE2L3N1bmRhbmNlX2ZpbG1fZmVzdGl2YWwuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Travis Wise, Sundance Film Festival, CC BY 2.0</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This week’s most pressing question: If money/time weren’t an obstacle, would you rather go to Davos or Sundance? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Tuesday: </strong>World Economic Forum meeting begins in Davos, Switzerland; Baseball Hall of Fame class of 2020 announced; Senate impeachment trial really begins; NYC Restaurant Week; earnings (Netflix, Halliburton, IBM, Capital One, TD Ameritrade, United Airlines)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Wednesday: </strong>Existing home sales; earnings (Johnson and Johnson, Abbott Labs, Baker Hughes, Northern Trust, Texas Instruments)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Thursday: </strong>Sundance Film Festival begins; Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists announces decision on "<a href="https://thebulletin.org/doomsday-clock/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Doomsday Clock</a>"; earnings (Procter and Gamble, Intel, Union Pacific, American Airlines, Comcast, Southwest, Travelers, E-Trade, JetBlue)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Friday: </strong>Earnings (American Express)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Saturday: </strong>Chinese New Year</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Sunday: </strong>Grammy Awards</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PODCAST
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
How to Win Deals and Influence People
</font></a>
</h1>

<!--[if mso]>

<img class="story-header-image" alt="Michael Jordan in Space Jam " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/Xoc3XpBrElaYo/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Look, we all have goals. For some of us, it’s not lying when we tell the dentist we floss 2x a week. For others, it’s getting a 180-year-old consumer goods giant to buy our 2.5-year-old company for $100 million.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Moiz Ali belongs in the “others” category. As the founder of natural personal care brand Native, he brokered the kind of deal with Procter and Gamble that young startups only dream of. But once the ink dried on the contract, the hard work began.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">This week on Morning Brew’s </strong><strong style="color:#000"><em>Business Casual</em></strong><strong style="color:#000"> podcast</strong>, Moiz takes us on a guided tour of the acquisition process—how to stand out, how to keep your head down, and how to make a graceful exit.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Even if you aren’t shopping your business, this episode has something for you:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>How to communicate any message to the right audience (and not blow your $$)</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>How to persevere when the odds are stacked against you</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>And a whole lot more</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Listen to the episode:</strong> <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/Moiz_Apple?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Apple</a> / <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/Moiz_Spotify?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Spotify</a> / <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/Moiz_All?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">everywhere else</a></p>

Al Sharpton \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc5NTU2NzA0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eTIMOTHY A. CLARY/AFP via Getty Image\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePresidential campaigns aren’t all four-hour selfie lines. Democrats vying for the nomination are putting on their wonk hats and unveiling plans to tackle racial economic inequality.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe numbers:\u003c/strong\u003e McKinsey \u003ca href=\"https://www.mckinsey.com/industries/public-sector/our-insights/the-economic-impact-of-closing-the-racial-wealth-gap?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eestimates\u003c/a\u003e that closing the racial wealth gap could lift U.S. GDP 4%–6% by 2028. Reducing barriers to banking alone could put $40,000 back into the pockets of black individuals. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003ePlan overload\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Sunday, former NYC mayor \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMike Bloomberg\u003c/strong\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/mike-bloomberg-at-site-of-racial-massacre-vows-aid-for-african-americans/2020/01/19/90780cd0-3aa3-11ea-baca-eb7ace0a3455_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eoutlined\u003c/a\u003e plans to triple the wealth of the average black family and almost double the ranks of black-owned businesses.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, former MA Gov. \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDeval Patrick\u003c/strong\u003e released his “\u003ca href=\"https://medium.com/@DevalPatrick/an-equity-agenda-for-black-americans-73a926e2ee2?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eEquity Agenda for Black Americans\u003c/a\u003e,” which includes supporting a plan for the federal government to pay reparations to the living descendants of African American slaves. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBloomberg and Patrick join other Democratic candidates who’ve already laid out blueprints pledging better housing, healthcare, and education for black Americans. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSen. Elizabeth Warren \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ewants to give minority entrepreneurs $7 billion in federal grants to help them start new companies. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePete Buttigieg’s\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e “Douglass Plan” seeks to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/policy-and-politics/2019/7/11/20690710/pete-buttigieg-douglass-plan-systemic-racism-black-voters?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etriple\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the number of entrepreneurs from underrepresented backgrounds and forgive or defer loans to black college students who create businesses after graduation. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003ePlans =/= votes \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBlack Americans are the Democratic Party’s most consistent voting segment. While 2016 turnout dropped 7 percentage points from 2012, many Democratic operatives are confident black voters will \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/bfc3c2a4a3384fd98676de85c4c34b98?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereturn\u003c/a\u003e in higher numbers this year and play a decisive role in swing states like Michigan. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBut...someone has to win.\u003c/strong\u003e Former VP Joe Biden has polled with anywhere from \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/as-primary-voting-nears-joe-biden-remains-strong-with-black-democrats-11579538921?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ea third\u003c/a\u003e to \u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/2020/1/13/21063906/joe-biden-national-poll-black-voters-primary?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ealmost half\u003c/a\u003e of black Democratic voters in his corner. Bernie Sanders is a steady No. 2 with 24%, according to a Quinnipiac poll, and Warren is in third with \u003c10%. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eDon’t count the black vote as a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://fivethirtyeight.com/features/why-do-black-democrats-usually-prefer-establishment-candidates/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emonolith\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, either. Polls show young black voters prefer Sanders.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn Munich on Sunday, Snap CEO Evan Spiegel said “\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/01/20/tiktok-pulled-into-the-middle-of-a-fight-between-snap-and-facebook.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eit’s possible\u003c/a\u003e” that TikTok, the Chinese video sharing app, could overtake Instagram. Yes—that Instagram, the platform with more than 1 billion monthly active users and which Bloomberg \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-06-25/value-of-facebook-s-instagram-estimated-to-top-100-billion?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eestimated\u003c/a\u003e to be worth over $100 billion in 2018.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhy? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTikTok’s “talent-based content is often more interesting than status-based content.” Meaning clever lip syncing \u003e pics of glamping in Patagonia. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“I love TikTok,” Spiegel said. “I’m a big fan.”\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eWith Zuck leading the charge, Facebook-owned Instagram has earned a reputation for copying some of Snapchat’s most beloved features, such as Stories. As Snap tries to escape Insta’s shadow, it’s invested in \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2019/11/20/snap-commits-750000-ar-influencers-2020?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eaugmented reality tech\u003c/a\u003e to differentiate itself from its peers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTikTok, on the other hand, came out of nowhere to become the \u003ca href=\"https://go.sensortower.com/rs/351-RWH-315/images/Sensor-Tower-Q4-2019-Data-Digest.pdf?src=landing-page\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esecond-most downloaded app\u003c/a\u003e in the world in 2019, according to Sensor Tower. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCoronavirus might sound like Day 2 of your Cabo trip, but it's causing concern across China ahead of one of the country's busiest travel seasons. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Monday, Chinese authorities \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2020/01/20/797926447/coronavirus-in-china-over-200-cases-human-to-human-transmission?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereported\u003c/a\u003e the virus, which causes pneumonia-like symptoms, had infected 200+ people with three confirmed deaths. U.K. experts \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/health-51048366?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e the number of cases may be closer to 1,700.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe situation is triggering memories of China’s 2002 SARS outbreak (another coronavirus strain), which infected 8,000+ people and killed 774.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHealth officials say animals passed the virus to humans at a market in Wuhan, China. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThere are now confirmed cases in major metro areas (Beijing, Shenzhen) and Thailand, South Korea, and Japan. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat scares health officials even more: \u003c/strong\u003eThey believe the virus may be spreading from human to human. The Chinese New Year is this Saturday, and an \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-19/wuhan-pneumonia-outbreak-widens-with-china-increasing-screening?srnd=premium%5C\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eestimated\u003c/a\u003e 3 billion trips are expected across the country. Shares in Chinese travel and hospitality companies sank yesterday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe \u003cspan\u003eWorld Health Organization\u003c/span\u003e will meet tomorrow to decide if this needs to be elevated to a global public style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat is not a joke. On Sunday, SpaceX \u003ca href=\"https://www.space.com/spacex-crew-dragon-launch-abort-test-success.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esuccessfully blew up\u003c/a\u003e one of its Falcon 9 rockets in a test of its abort system. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe company needed to prove astronauts can be safely ejected from the spacecraft in the event of a bad launch, and, well, it was a “picture perfect mission,” \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-space-exploration-spacex/spacex-says-picture-perfect-test-paves-way-for-human-mission-idUSKBN1ZI054?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eaccording to CEO Elon Musk\u003c/a\u003e. “It went as well as one can possibly expect.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNo one was in the capsule this time around.
